Text: Effective Date: August 1, 2023
Label: Updated Privacy Policy
Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
We may collect your Personal Information from a device associated with you or your household:

Desktop Information: We collect technical information when you visit our websites or services. This may include information such as your Internet Protocol (IP) address, your device operating system and browser type, a unique device identifier, the address of referring websites, the path you take through our websites, and other information about your session on our websites.
Mobile Information: When you use or access our Services from a mobile device, we may collect information such as your unique device ID and your location. If you download and use an App, we and our service providers may track and collect App usage data, such as the date and time the App on your device accesses our servers and what information and files have been downloaded to the App based on your device number, as well as any other Personal Information specified by the App in its terms or notices.
Geolocation information: We may collect or infer information about your general or precise location when you access or use the Services, visit our restaurants or support center, or turn on Bluetooth, Wi-Fi or other geolocation functionality on your device.
Device-Based Advertising: We may also use device information, particularly in mobile advertising, to help deliver our ads and measure ad campaign effectiveness. Darden and the companies we work with may collect some certain information when you visit one of our sites or see our ads. Compiling and comparing this information creates a unique ID for individual devices and can be "matched" to the same information on other sites or mobile applications. Some companies we work with are also able to associate related devices into households based on common characteristics, such as IP addresses.
Device Usage Research: We may participate in the Adobe Marketing Cloud Device Co-op. This helps us understand how you use our website and apps across your devices so that we can better tailor promotions to you.
We may collect your Personal Information using automated technologies:

Cookies: We use a variety of technologies, including cookies, to collect information about your online/mobile activity when you visit our site(s). Cookies are small text files that a website server stores on your computer or device. They’re typically used to remember your account login preferences, monitor website traffic, provide customer support like live chat, and help us better customize our site for your individual preferences.
Pixels/Beacons: We or third-party ad servers, including Facebook, may use cookies or invisible pixels or beacons on our websites or mobile apps to count how many users visit certain pages or take certain actions to collect or receive information from our websites, mobile apps and elsewhere on the Internet. We may use this information to improve our marketing programs and content and target advertisements on this website and/or other sites.
Online Behavioral Advertising (OBA): There are ways we use OBA on third-party websites and mobile apps that are not affiliated with Darden.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Interest-Based Advertising: The third parties we contract with may use cookies or other technologies to gather interest-based information to
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
We may collect your Personal Information from our Darden family of restaurants such as:

Olive Garden
LongHorn Steakhouse
Cheddar’s Scratch Kitchen
Yard House
The Capital Grille
The Capital Burger
Seasons 52
Bahama Breeze
Eddie V's
Ruth’s Chris
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
We may collect your Personal Information from other sources:

Third Parties: We may, from time to time, supplement the information we collect about you from third-party sources from whom we collect or purchase Personal Information in order to enhance our ability to serve you, tailor content to you, and offer you products or services that we believe may be of interest to you. We may combine the information we received from those sources with the information provided directly by you.
Vendors: Our vendors may disclose your Personal Information to us. For example, if you order food or catering, order gift cards, make a purchase for merchandise, make a payment, or provide feedback on your experiences, you may submit Personal Information to one or more vendors that may disclose your information to us. Our vendors may also receive information from geolocation data providers to help us understand aggregate visit patterns in restaurant markets of interest, but these providers get the location data from sources other than our own apps and websites. Additionally, for certain features of the online services, you may log in through your third-party social media account or share content from the online Services through third-party social media platforms. When you submit information to a third party, you are subject to that third party’s terms of use and privacy policies, for which we are not responsible.
Top of Page
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
How Your Personal Information Is Disclosed
Darden Family: We may disclose your Personal Information within the Darden family of restaurants. The Darden Family currently includes Darden, Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen, Yard House, The Capital Grille, The Capital Burger, Seasons 52, Bahama Breeze, Ruth’s Chris, and Eddie V's, as well as our affiliates and subsidiaries. Members of the Darden family who receive this information from us are not authorized to use or disclose the information except as set out in this privacy statement.
Third Parties: In order to serve you, we disclose your Personal Information to service providers or third parties that perform functions on our behalf. We may disclose your Personal Information with vendors or third parties who provide services to us, such as fulfilling orders, facilitating reservations, providing data processing and other information technology services, managing promotions, managing any rewards programs, surveys, contests, prize draws, and sweepstakes, carrying out research and analysis, and personalizing individual Darden customer experiences. We do not allow these vendors to use this information or to disclose it for any purpose other than as allowed by law or to provide services on our behalf or on an aggregated basis for statistical, benchmarking, or other analytical services.

As permitted by law, we also disclose information collected about you with companies with whom we have formal agreements to conduct analysis, engage in customer research, benchmarking, and improve our products or services.

We may decide to sell or transfer all or part of our business for strategic or other business reasons. As part of that sale or transfer, we may pass the information we have collected and stored, including Personal Information, to anyone involved in the sale or transfer.
Compliance With Laws: We may disclose your Personal Information and other information to third parties, including governmental authorities, to comply with any applicable law, regulation, legal process, or enforceable governmental request or if we believe in good faith that such disclosure is necessary to protect against harm to the rights, property or safety of Darden, our customers, or the public as required or permitted by law (especially in emergency situations).
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Category of Personal Information	Purpose of Collection	Third Parties to which information was disclosed	Categories of Sources
Category of Personal Information
Personal Identifiers: Names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, date of birth, and other identifiers.

Personal Identifiers of Others: Names, postal addresses, e-mail addresses, and telephone numbers of others to whom you ask us to send information

Purpose of Collection
We may collect this information to establish a guest record of you, set up rewards and other accounts, create log in credentials for you, and for similar reasons.

We may collect this information to communicate to you about your purchases, transactions, special events, programs, rewards, surveys, contests, sweepstakes, and other offers or promotions.

We may collect this information to respond to and communicate with you about your requests, concerns, questions, and comments.

Third Parties to which information was disclosed
Affiliates, delivery services, marketing, and advertising services, providers of payment services, transactional support providers, providers of technical services

We sell or share for targeted advertising purposes email addresses and online identifiers to marketing and advertising services.

We may collect this information to determine what interests you to facilitate targeted communications of products and services to you and to judge the effectiveness of any online marketing campaigns.

Text: The Right to Know\nYou have the right to request access to Personal Information collected about you and information regarding the source of that Personal Information, the purposes for which we collect it, and the third parties and service providers with whom we disclose it.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text:
You or your authorized agent may exercise this right by submitting a verifiable consumer request to us by either:

Submitting your request here
Calling 1-888-467-4123
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: The Right to Request Deletion\nYou or your authorized agent also have a right to request that we delete your Personal Information.
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text:
You may exercise this right by submitting a verifiable consumer request to us by either:

Submitting your request here
Calling 1-888-467-4123
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: The Right to Correct Your Information\nYou or your authorized agent have the right to request that any inaccurate or incomplete Personal Information held by us or on our behalf is corrected, by contacting us. We will take reasonable steps to ensure the accuracy of the Personal Information we retain about you. It is your responsibility to ensure you submit true, accurate, and complete information to us, and timely update us in the event this information changes.
Label: Description of Right to Correct Information

Text:
You may exercise this right by:

Submitting your request here
Calling 1-888-467-4123
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: The Right to Opt Out of Sales or Sharing for Targeted Advertising\nYou or your authorized agent have the right, subject to certain exceptions defined in the CCPA and other applicable laws and regulations, to request that we refrain from selling or sharing for targeted advertising your Personal Information in the future.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text:
You may exercise this right without verification by:

Submitting your request here
Calling 1-888-467-4123
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: The Right to Limit the Use of Sensitive Personal Information Processing\nDarden uses and discloses sensitive personal information only for purposes permitted under California law. We therefore do not offer a right to limit the use and disclosure of such information.
Label: Description of Right to Limit use of PI

Text:
The Right to Non-Discrimination
You or your authorized agent have the right not to receive discriminatory treatment for exercising any of your CCPA rights. Unless permitted by the CCPA, we will not:

Deny you services.
Charge you different prices or rates for services, including through granting discounts or other benefits, or imposing penalties.
Provide you a different level or quality of services.
Suggest that you may receive a different price or rate for services or a different level or quality of services.
However, we may offer you certain financial incentives permitted by the CCPA that can result in different prices, rates, or quality levels. Any CCPA-permitted financial incentive we offer will reasonably relate to your Personal Information’s value and contain written terms that describe the program’s material aspects. Participation in a financial incentive program requires your prior opt in consent, which you may revoke at any time.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

Text: Effective Date: August 1, 2023
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: For example, when you place an order online, to fulfill your order, we collect personal information, such as name, address, phone number, and credit or debit card information
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Your Privacy\nOur Notice describes the information we collect from and about you during your visit to our online interfaces (including websites, mobile applications, social media, or other digital channels), via your in-restaurant interactions, and through your interaction with in-restaurant devices owned or controlled by us (collectively, the “Sites”)
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: This may include information such as your Internet Protocol (IP) address, your device operating system and browser type, a unique device identifier, the address of referring websites, the path you take through our websites, and other information about your session on our websites.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: When you use or access our Services from a mobile device, we may collect information such as your unique device ID and your location. If you download and use an App, we and our service providers may track and collect App usage data, such as the date and time the App on your device accesses our servers and what information and files have been downloaded to the App based on your device number, as well as any other Personal Information specified by the App in its terms or notices.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Geolocation information: We may collect or infer information about your general or precise location when you access or use the Services, visit our restaurants or support center, or turn on Bluetooth, Wi-Fi or other geolocation functionality on your device.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Device-Based Advertising: We may also use device information, particularly in mobile advertising, to help deliver our ads and measure ad campaign effectiveness. Darden and the companies we work with may collect some certain information when you visit one of our sites or see our ads
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
We may collect your Personal Information using automated technologies:

Cookies: We use a variety of technologies, including cookies, to collect information about your online/mobile activity when you visit our site(s). Cookies are small text files that a website server stores on your computer or device. They’re typically used to remember your account login preferences, monitor website traffic, provide customer support like live chat, and help us better customize our site for your individual preferences.
Pixels/Beacons: We or third-party ad servers, including Facebook, may use cookies or invisible pixels or beacons on our websites or mobile apps to count how many users visit certain pages or take certain actions to collect or receive information from our websites, mobile apps and elsewhere on the Internet. We may use this information to improve our marketing programs and content and target advertisements on this website and/or other sites.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Pixels/Beacons: We or third-party ad servers, including Facebook, may use cookies or invisible pixels or beacons on our websites or mobile apps to count how many users visit certain pages or take certain actions to collect or receive information from our websites, mobile apps and elsewhere on the Internet. We may use this information to improve our marketing programs and content and target advertisements on this website and/or other sites.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
We may collect your Personal Information from our Darden family of restaurants such as:

Olive Garden
LongHorn Steakhouse
Cheddar’s Scratch Kitchen
Yard House
The Capital Grille
The Capital Burger
Seasons 52
Bahama Breeze
Eddie V's
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Ruth’s Chris
We may collect your Personal Information from other sources:

Third Parties: We may, from time to time, supplement the information we collect about you from third-party sources from whom we collect or purchase Personal Information in order to enhance our ability to serve you, tailor content to you, and offer you products or services that we believe may be of interest to you. We may combine the information we received from those sources with the information provided directly by you.
Vendors: Our vendors may disclose your Personal Information to us. For example, if you order food or catering, order gift cards, make a purchase for merchandise, make a payment, or provide feedback on your experiences, you may submit Personal Information to one or more vendors that may disclose your information to us. Our vendors may also receive information from geolocation data providers to help us understand aggregate visit patterns in restaurant markets of interest, but these providers get the location data from sources other than our own apps and websites.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected
Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: For targeted advertising and marketing services;
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: To the extent permitted by applicable law and with your consent where required, we also use information collected through automated means for purposes such as (i) customizing our users’ visits to our site, (ii) delivering content (including advertising) tailored to our users’ interests and the manner in which our users browse our site, and (iii) managing our site and other aspects of our business. To the extent permitted by applicable law, we also may use this information to provide you with ads about our products when you browse this and other websites or use our mobile apps.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: How Your Personal Information Is Disclosed\nDarden Family: We may disclose your Personal Information within the Darden family of restaurants. The Darden Family currently includes Darden, Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen, Yard House, The Capital Grille, The Capital Burger, Seasons 52, Bahama Breeze, Ruth’s Chris, and Eddie V's, as well as our affiliates and subsidiaries.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Third Parties: In order to serve you, we disclose your Personal Information to service providers or third parties that perform functions on our behalf. We may disclose your Personal Information with vendors or third parties who provide services to us, such as fulfilling orders, facilitating reservations, providing data processing and other information technology services, managing promotions, managing any rewards programs, surveys, contests, prize draws, and sweepstakes, carrying out research and analysis, and personalizing individual Darden customer experiences
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text:
As permitted by law, we also disclose information collected about you with companies with whom we have formal agreements to conduct analysis, engage in customer research, benchmarking, and improve our products or services.

We may decide to sell or transfer all or part of our business for strategic or other business reasons. As part of that sale or transfer, we may pass the information we have collected and stored, including Personal Information, to anyone involved in the sale or transfer.
Compliance With Laws: We may disclose your Personal Information and other information to third parties, including governmental authorities, to comply with any applicable law, regulation, legal process, or enforceable governmental request or if we believe in good faith that such disclosure is necessary to protect against harm to the rights, property or safety of Darden, our customers, or the public as required or permitted by law (especially in emergency situations).
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: We may decide to sell or transfer all or part of our business for strategic or other business reasons. As part of that sale or transfer, we may pass the information we have collected and stored, including Personal Information, to anyone involved in the sale or transfer.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Sold

Text:
Personal Information We Collect, Use, and Disclose
We collect, use, and disclose your Personal Information, as described below, for our business and commercial purposes.

Category of Personal Information	Purpose of Collection	Third Parties to which information was disclosed	Categories of Sources
Category of Personal Information
Personal Identifiers: Names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, date of birth, and other identifiers.

Personal Identifiers of Others: Names, postal addresses, e-mail addresses, and telephone numbers of others to whom you ask us to send information

Purpose of Collection
We may collect this information to establish a guest record of you, set up rewards and other accounts, create log in credentials for you, and for similar reasons.

We may collect this information to communicate to you about your purchases, transactions, special events, programs, rewards, surveys, contests, sweepstakes, and other offers or promotions.

We may collect this information to respond to and communicate with you about your requests, concerns, questions, and comments.

Third Parties to which information was disclosed
Affiliates, delivery services, marketing, and advertising services, providers of payment services, transactional support providers, providers of technical services

We sell or share for targeted advertising purposes email addresses and online identifiers to marketing and advertising services.

Categories of Sources
Directly from you

Our business partners and affiliates

Third Parties you direct to disclose information to us

Social Networks

Category of Personal Information
Demographic Information: Date of birth, marital status, family structures, educational levels, employment status, and household income and dwelling, characteristics of protected classifications under state or federal law, such as gender, race, and military status

Purpose of Collection
We may collect this information to determine what interests you to facilitate targeted communications of products and services to you and to judge the effectiveness of any online marketing campaigns.

Third Parties to which information was disclosed
Affiliates, delivery services, marketing, and advertising services, providers of payment services, transactional support providers, and providers of technical services.

We sell or share for targeted advertising purposes Internet/Network Information to marketing and advertising services.

Categories of Sources
Directly from you

Our business partners and affiliates

Financial Information: Payment information such as payment card details, financial account information, billing address, and home mortgage.

Purpose of Collection
Process and collect payments for goods and services.

Delivery services, providers of payment services, and transactional support providers.

Categories of Sources
Directly from you

Our business partners and affiliates

Social Networks

Commercial Information: Online order and reservation history, and records of products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies.

Purpose of Collection
We may collect this information to process your reservations, your loyalty and/or rewards accounts.

We may collect this information to maintain a record of your dining history preferences and tendencies to better serve you and personalize an experience for you.

Third Parties to which information was disclosed
Affiliates, delivery services, marketing and advertising services, providers of payment services, transactional support providers, and providers of technical services.

Categories of Sources
Directly from you

Our business partners and affiliates

Third Parties you direct to disclose information to us

Social Networks

Category of Personal Information
Internet/Network Information: Device information, logs, analytics data, browsing history, search history, and information regarding a resident’s interaction with an internet website, mobile app, application, or advertisement.

Purpose of Collection
We may collect this information to improve our website or mobile app functionality, improve transaction bandwidth, and personalize your experience.

We may collect this information to determine what interests you to facilitate targeted communications of products and services to you, and to judge the effectiveness of any online marketing campaigns.

Third Parties to which information was disclosed
Affiliates, delivery services, marketing and advertising services, providers of payment services, transactional support providers, and providers of technical services.

Geolocation: Precise location from our device or generated based on IP address.

Purpose of Collection
We may collect your address; the location associated with the device used regarding your internet activity in order to create demographic analysis of visits to our site and promote interests in our products to better market to and understand our customers.

Internet/Network Information: Device information, logs, analytics data, browsing history, search history, and information regarding a resident’s interaction with an internet website, mobile app, application, or advertisement.

Purpose of Collection
We may collect this information to improve our website or mobile app functionality, improve transaction bandwidth, and personalize your experience.

We may collect this information to determine what interests you to facilitate targeted communications of products and services to you, and to judge the effectiveness of any online marketing campaigns.

Third Parties to which information was disclosed
Affiliates, delivery services, marketing and advertising services, providers of payment services, transactional support providers, and providers of technical services.

We sell or share for targeted advertising purposes Internet/Network Information to marketing and advertising services.

We track the user sessions with Quantum Metrics.

Text: The Right to Know\nYou have the right to request access to Personal Information collected about you and information regarding the source of that Personal Information, the purposes for which we collect it, and the third parties and service providers with whom we disclose it.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: The Right to Correct Your Information\nYou or your authorized agent have the right to request that any inaccurate or incomplete Personal Information held by us or on our behalf is corrected, by contacting us.

Text: The Right to Opt Out of Sales or Sharing for Targeted Advertising\nYou or your authorized agent have the right, subject to certain exceptions defined in the CCPA and other applicable laws and regulations, to request that we refrain from selling or sharing for targeted advertising your Personal Information in the future.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: The Right to Limit the Use of Sensitive Personal Information Processing\nDarden uses and discloses sensitive personal information only for purposes permitted under California law. We therefore do not offer a right to limit the use and disclosure of such information.
Label: Description of Right to Limit use of PI

Text:
The Right to Non-Discrimination
You or your authorized agent have the right not to receive discriminatory treatment for exercising any of your CCPA rights. Unless permitted by the CCPA, we will not:

Deny you services.
Charge you different prices or rates for services, including through granting discounts or other benefits, or imposing penalties.
Provide you a different level or quality of services.
Suggest that you may receive a different price or rate for services or a different level or quality of services.
Label: Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

Text: Changes to this Notice\nWe reserve the right to modify this Notice at any time for any reason at our discretion. Any change to this Notice will be posted on our Sites and your continued use of such Site shall be deemed your acceptance of any modified terms.
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: Your Privacy\nWhen you visit any web site, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the website work as you expect it to. The information can give you a more personalized web experience.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Strictly Necessary Cookies\nAlways Active\nThese essential cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Functional Cookies\nAlways Active\nThese cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and more personalized features
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: They may be set by us or by third-party providers whose services we have added to our pages.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Functional Cookies
Always Active
These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and more personalized features. They may be set by us or by third-party providers whose services we have added to our pages.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Performance Cookies\nAlways Active\nThese cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Targeting Cookies\nTargeting Cookies Active\nThese cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant advertising on other sites.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed
